priorVersion.title: CDISC SEND Respiratory Test Code Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C120534

self.title: CDISC SEND Respiratory Test Code Terminology

definition: Terminology related to the non-clinical respiratory test code codelist.
name: SEND Respiratory Test Code
preferredTerm: CDISC SEND Respiratory Test Code Terminology

terms.definition: A measurement of respiratory tract resistance to airflow during inspiration and expiration.
An assessment of the amount of air that is being inspired and expired.
The brief period at the end of exhalation when respiration ceases to adjust for oxygen consumption. The length of the pause varies with oxygen demand.
The brief period at the end of inhalation when respiration ceases to adjust for oxygen consumption. The length of the pause varies with oxygen demand.
Time required for reaching a fixed percentage of tidal volume during expiration.
The amount of time it takes for exhalation of air to occur.
Volume of air that a subject with fully inflated lungs can breathe out per unit time.
The amount of time it takes for inhalation of air to occur.
The mean pressure of the blood within the pulmonary circulation. The pulmonary pressure may be directly measured by insertion of an intra-arterial catheter connected to a transducer.
The amount of gas inspired or expired in one minute.
The maximum rate of exhalation.
A unitless index of airway hyperreactivity used to evaluate changes in the shape of the airflow pattern of a subject using a whole-body flow plethysmograph.
The peak pressure in the lungs during expiration.
The maximum rate of inhalation.
The maximum pressure of inhaled air.
The blood pressure in the pulmonary artery after the contraction of the heart while the chambers of the heart refill with blood.
The elasticity of the pulmonary walls.
The blood pressure in the pulmonary artery during the contraction of the left ventricle of the heart.
The rate of breathing (inhalation and exhalation) measured within in a unit time, usually expressed as breaths per minute. (NCI)
The volume of air moved into and out of the lungs during breathing at rest.
The total volume of air in the lungs after maximum inhalation.
